intro: Hieracium hadiomeriforme, commonly known as the Hadiomeriforme hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its basal rosette of narrow, grass-like leaves and produces numerous yellow flowers arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence. Native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia, this species thrives in rocky and alpine environments. The plant has a hairy stem and is often found in open, sunny habitats at high elevations. It is a perennial species with a relatively short flowering period during the summer months.
